title: Add different gameplay formats

comments.body: Can you be more specific on what you're requesting? Do you just mean adding 60 card decks?
comments.author: [wait...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/118194332611503434213/)

comments.body: The post I made on the forum that Beholder is referencing was regarding different play formats like Momir basic, Hermit Druid, and Stone Hewer (Wagic that I play on my psp has these).
comments.author: [mikewpea...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/118017494362655792385/)

comments.body:
I can't find what the Hermit Druid and Stone Hewer formats are but those cards are both not supported at the moment(revealing cards and searching the library).
Momir basic looks doable, I just hope our cardpool is big enough to make it fun.
Other formats that can maybe be added:
Singleton, Prismatic, Pauper, Tribal, Type 4. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magic:_The_Gathering_formats
comments.author: [BeHold...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/116281131070537299190/)

comments.body: here is the link to the svn revision of Wagic that added these modes to that program.  There are some details there in the body of the commit notes and a few more in the comments below. https://code.google.com/p/wagic/source/detail?r=3687

comments.body: I'm not sure if this is the right place - but I would like to see "Core set only" format. Only 11th edition, 10th edition, 9th edition and so on.
comments.author: [jaze...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/102707833900773093014/)

comments.body: "core sets only" format would be very useful for beginners, because they contain simpler cards. I actually think it should be made the default, because it's simpler and all decent M:tG players will know there are more cards. They will look for a way to enable it.
comments.author: [jaze...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/102707833900773093014/)

comments.body:
@ jazevec:

I don't know if I'd call "core sets only" a different format but it's a good suggestion and looks not very hard to implement.
Did you see issue 198 ?
